contentList.content: All things come from and return to this earth. These sentient minerals contain splinters of a world's soul, connecting them to the ecosystems they live in.
Derived from rock and soil, these stoneborn live in the silence of a still earth. They arise to the surface when called for, but most are unaware of their existence.
Constructed by sorcerers, these sentient statues are conduits for their master's magics. They wait in silence, hoping for the day that they are released from their bonds of servitude.
Your exterior is natural barrier to all damage. Increase Constitution by 1.
Your affinity to nature leaves you resistant to Poison Damage and reduces your chance to be poisoned.
Broken off from the crust of the world, your body is tougher than most all else. Your armor is set to 15 + your Constitution modifier when wearing no armor.
They would wound you if they could make a dent. Damaged is reduced if the type of damage is Slashing or Piercing.
Your build speaks for itself. You are an extra size larger than most others, and you have an increased carrying capacity.
Your fists were forged for battle. Unarmed attacks have an increase of 1d8 Bludgeoning damage.
